ygData.messageBody:
I agree that crossing of spells from one class to another is a terrible
idea. We all new when we started a Wizard that we had the most powerful
offensive spells in the game. We gave up the other benefits to gain that
one. I don't want some other class being able to learn my big damage spells
any more than i think we should learn theirs. Keep in mind this would have
to work both ways and if ye have an enchanter or Necro that can damage as
much as a Wizard why have a Wizard at all?? You have to take the weakness
with the Strength. start another char to play when no one else is online on
that can solo easier. I started a Monk and a troll Shaman to play when no
one is around to group with and have a blast with those guys. Lets keep
classes unique thats what makes it fun playing different classes is that you
have to play each one different.

just my thoughts...
Quindinar

> Robin McCaig wrote:
>
> > From: "Robin McCaig" <twister@...>
> >
> > I hear that when Specialization come in that we will be able to cast the
> > spell using less mana depending on what we are specializing in. That
being
> > the case, If we specialize in a certain area such as conjuration, will
we
> > get new spells such as summon food and water, etc. If they decide to
let us
> > have hybrid spells from other races, it seems to me like they should
limit
> > the spells the wizard gets depending on which area of specialization he
is
> > in. If I wated to get SoW for example, I would have to train in the
> > specialization spell trait that is used when SoW is cast (alteration,
> > divination, etc.). This would allow us to get hybrid spells without
making
> > us too powerful, and allow the wizard player to be able to be a more
well
> > rounded profession rather than being so dependant on others to buff and
> > group with. I don't know about you, but there are times when I am
playing
> > and no one is online who wants to group with me. This can be
frustrating
> > cause we are not good at melee.
> >
> > Just my two cents worth.
>
